column5: In spirit of the Orillia Perch Festival, I decided to head out and try my luck at landing a monster perch from Simcoe (not in the festival)  This was my first time fishing Lake Simcoe for perch, and I have to say that I am quite pleased with my results!  Both my buddy Grant and I each set new PB Perch. Mine weighed in at a whopping 1.8 lbs, and his just under with 1.4 lbs.  So far in 2010, I have set 3 PB's - Walleye, Crappie & Perch Let's hope the PB's continue!  Here are some shots from today!  Me with my PB, and another jumbo   Grant with his new PB
wowzers those are pigs!  Well done!
Nice fish,and back ground.CUDZ you on this? LOL  Now the launch will be full of out of towners.LOL  j/k bud
I drove an hour away from Barrie and caught 1 shaker that was half the size of those perch.
And you catch them from shore aswell.
wow...those are nice perch...good job....here's to your next PB
Fantastic Jumbos didn't know they got that big in there
nice perch there I need to go fishing now why the heck am I still inside on the computer Im a nerd.

Thanks guys, it was a blast for sure. I was hesitant about going out and targeting perch...but wow, I was impressed with the aggressiveness and the fight they put up! I literally thought I hooked into a bass when I had my PB on. I was shocked when I saw it coming up and it was a perch!! I enjoyed it so much, I think I will get out there again in the next couple days!
thatta boy Stoty, i hope you measured that PB and got a shot with our team logo, my measly little perch would get eaten by that monster!
He probably superimposed that background on there.  There are no perch near those buildings.  I repeat, there are no perch!
look like some beauties!    they sure do! and some bigger..! I cant wait to get out there and try my luck. have only been fishin from shore or threw the ice so far
Caught half a dozen jumbos from shore yesterday (only had about an hour and used worms).  They are definitely in.
